alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield; Northern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fairfield and northern New Haven Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Monroe, or near Shelton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shelton around 250 PM EDT. Seymour, Orange and Derby around 255 PM EDT. Woodbridge around 300 PM EDT. Naugatuck, Beacon Falls and Bethany around 305 PM EDT. Hamden and Prospect around 310 PM EDT. Wallingford and Cheshire around 315 PM EDT. Wolcott around 320 PM EDT. Meriden and Middlefield around 325 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oxford, Ansonia and Easton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
